code: @Manual{,   title = {pcir: Potential for Conflict Index in R},   author = {Francesca Palmeira},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/fblpalmeira/pcir}, }

title: Potential for Conflict Index in R
text: pcir R package developed assist researchers practitioners calculating, comparing, visualizing Potential Conflict Index (PCI) among stakeholders. PCI descriptive statistical method designed enhance understanding outcomes human dimensions research(Manfredo et al. 2003; Vaske et al. 2010). concepts consensus, disagreement, conflict relevant across wide range disciplines, including economics, political science, psychology, sociology, natural resource management. Although PCI can calculated using software Excel, SPSS, SAS, dedicated R package existed analysis — now. package developed part training rOpenSci Champions Program, supported Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. Additional information: Introducing rOpenSci Champions - Cohort 2023-2024

title: Potential for Conflict Index in R

title: Potential for Conflict Index in R
text: counting(): Summarizes data calculating counts, percentages, means, standard deviations. pci(): Computes Potential Conflict Index summary data. bubble(): Visualizes PCI results using bubble plot.

title: Potential for Conflict Index in R
text: Install development version pcir directly GitHub:
code: # Uncomment the line below if devtools is not installed # install.packages("devtools")  devtools::install_github("fblpalmeira/pcir")

title: Potential for Conflict Index in R
text: installation, load package: Example dataset: Count responses: Calculate PCI: Visualize bubble plot:  Figure 3. Bubble chart illustrating Potential Conflict Indices.
code: library(pcir) df1 <- data.frame(   A = c(-1, 2, 2, 3, -1),   B = c(-1, 2, 3, -1, 2),   C = c(1, 2, -2, 3, -1),   D = c(3, 2, 1, -1, -2),   E = c(2, 3, 1, -1, -3)   ) df_count <- counting(df1) df_count df_pci <- pci(df_count) df_pci # The bubble function creates a bubble plot to visualize the PCI results bubble_plot <- bubble(df_pci) bubble_plot # Display the bubble plot

title: Potential for Conflict Index in R
text: Manfredo, M., Vaske, J., Teel, T. (2003). potential conflict index: graphic approach practical significance human dimensions research. Human Dimensions Wildlife, 8(3), 219-228. Vaske, J. J., Beaman, J., Barreto, H., Shelby, L. B. (2010). extension validation potential conflict index. Leisure Sciences, 32(3), 240-254.
